name: Hotel Ibis Lisboa Jose Malhoa

reviews.text: Everything was just fine. I would just recommend that internet access could be made more promptly and easily as asking for the little pieces of paper every 30 minutes is kind of annoying and nonsense.
reviews.title: Just fine

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Staff is very pleasant and professional. Rooms are clean and quiet on both sides. The beds are really comfortable and I suffer from a bad back. There is a wonderful vegetarian restaurant nearby called green pepper that I strongly recommend. This was my second stay and I really enjoyed it.
reviews.title: Just ideal

reviews.text: Booked 2 connecting rooms & stayed on the 11th floor of the hotel during our trip to Lisbon last Dec 2012. Overall, although the hotel is conveniently located -- close to the Sete Rios station. This is the station where the long-distance buses stop, as well as the train station. Also conveniently linked to Sete Rios is the Jardim Zoológico metro station. From Jardim Zoológico station, you have access to all the major tourist spots like Restauradores & Rossio Squares. And, to go to the airport from Jardim Zoológico station, all you need is to change from the Azul (blue) line at Sao Sebastiao station and hop to the Vermelha (red) line that goes straight to the airport.
reviews.title: Good location, value but can be a bit noisy

reviews.text: However, one gripe I had with the hotel is the effectiveness of the room’s soundproofing method. As my family stayed in connecting rooms, I can hear everything happening in the next room, even with the connecting door closed shut! And worst, you can hear things happening along the hallway outside the room – people talking & going in and out of their rooms. All these can really mess up your sleep...
reviews.title: We got what we paid for!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed for 5 nights in Lisbon at Jose Malhoa. Not too far from the airport and just 5 stops away from the Restauradores which is where the main action of the city is. The metro station for Jose Malhoa is the Praca De Espanha and it is 5-6 min walk from the hotel. The rooms are small and typically IBIS but for the price you pay, I think this is a steal. A great front desk, decent breakfast (no warm stuff like omelettes etc) and a clean room every evening when you come back is all you can ask for. The lunch/dinner is nothing great (I had issues as I am a vegetarian) - so best if you eat outside and come back to the hotel. The Sana Malhoa next door has a good restaurant where you can find some vegetarian stuff like Risotto etc.
reviews.title: Typically Ibis

reviews.text: Close to the airport - good connections to downtown and sights - cheap, good comfort , clean and the ba prices beats anything - nice and kind staff - all speak good english. Breakfast essential but ok - dont think about room service and fitnessromm but hey you're in Lisbon - walk around and find a good cheap restaurant in the neighbourhood or downtown. Missed safe in the room..
reviews.title: If its all about prices then it's a no-brainer

reviews.text: I have stayed in a few Ibis before, I found that this ibis has the best qualities; the staffs are nice, the bathroom is spacious compare to the other Ibis and the renovation overall is relatively new. One of the cons is that the hotel is a bit far from the metro station, other than that, I highly recommend this hotel if you are looking for basic and good value option.
reviews.title: Good Value and comfortable.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed in the hotel for 1 night only to watch a champions league game and see the city of Lisboa. The hotel is great with its facilities and cleanness, but the staff were a bit rude, and the location was far from the nice places, which makes it difficult in Lisbon where public transportation is not well structured.
reviews.title: Good. It is an Ibis after all!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: With a car all would be great especially with the free parking you can spot across the street from the Hotel (Thanks to MJGKentUk's review in April 2012)
reviews.title: Great Value!

reviews.text: the hotel is new. the rooms are modern. the tv gives a clear picture.the shower is very useful with a good water pressure . the 6 euros for the breakfast is well worth paying. the breakfast buffet is very rich and tasty .the only drawback is the location because it is away from the town center but if you dont mind walking and using public transport the praca de espanha metro stop is a 10 minute walk from the hotel
reviews.title: good value for money

reviews.text: I checked in at noon and asked for a room facing the back of the hotel, if possible not on a very high floor (hoping I would be less disturbed by the airplanes that were flying above our heads). At the time the only room available was a room facing the street, so I was asked to return later.
reviews.title: Bath towels for the face,drunkers,lies and deception.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Service: 1) When I returned, the only room left for me was a room on the 10th floor (the hotel has 14 floors), because according to the hotel Manager they were fully booked and to get a room on a lower floor, I should have made a reservation when I came in!!! I guess that had to do with the low price I had paid reserving the room 5 weeks ago, since there were people popping in without a reservation, feeling disappointed from the prices at the Novotel across the street, and paying 62 euros for one night's sleep at the 2* Ibis hotel (room only).
reviews.title: Very good for a fair price

reviews.text: Hotel is located in a area ouside of the central district. It is a 5/10 minute walk from the Metro. Check-in was fast and friendly. Staff is very helpful in answering quesitons etc. Safe deposit box is available at the guest registration desk. Room is nice, not huge but space to move around in. Free wifi, flat screen TV, comfortable double bed and a window that can be opened. Bath room is spotless, there is a hair dryer. Beware that the hotel is over the flight path for aircraft arriving and departing from the International airport, but no flying late at night or early in the morning so a quiet sleep is possible, you might want to bring ear plugs. Nice buffet breakfast is offered at around 6 euros, plenty of food to fill up on before starting out on a day of sightseeing.
reviews.title: Nice hotel

reviews.text: I really enjoyed the peacefulness and cleanliness of this hotel. It is comparable to a holiday Inn in the USA. The staff was superb and I even got free breakfast for showing my isic student card. It is located outside of the old part or the "centre" of Lisbon but its only about 7 subway stops away. For one night after we got in on a late bus, it worked out great.
reviews.title: Clean, Friendly, Comfortable

reviews.text: This hotel is very clean and has a modern look. The staff is very helpful and polite. The bar is open 24 hours so it was convinient fior us because we were hungry at 3am in the morning and we were able to get something to eat. The only down side is that you are not in the city center.
reviews.title: Clean and affordable.
Excellent value for money
reviews.text: We made a citytrip to Lisbon, a city where i had never been before. We booked the Ibis because it was really cheap, and you always know what to expect from the ibis chain. The hotel is located about 5 minutes from metro station Praca Espanha. From there it takes about 5-19 minutes to reach the real city centre. The rooms are clean, and in very good state. Planes are flying over the hotel all day long, but that didn't bother me at all, since the rooms are soundproof. We booked breakfast as well, which is really nice as well. Plenty of choice!! Big surprise for us was that you can get free wifi vouchers at the reception desk. The vouchers give you 30 minutes free internet, but you can always ask for more vouchers. Staff at the hotel is very helpfull, the bar is open 24/7, and the drinks are available at real good prices!! I think this hotel deserves 3 stars rather than 2. We wil, definately come back here if we visit Lisbon again. And before i forget: Airport bus 2 stops almost in front of the hotel, takes about 25 minutes..

During our weekend in Lisbon we stayed in this hotel. It was rated as ** but we were surprised how comfortable, clean and complete it was. Good beds, nice bathroom, friendly staff. We were surprised too by the free WIFI internet in our room. The breakfest was very, very complete for just € 6,00. Also it was nice to end our day with a drink in the bar, opened 24/7, for very acceptable prices.
reviews.title: Lovely Lisbon weekend in a very nice hotel for a very good price

description: The Ibis Lisboa Jose Malhoa hotel is located in the city centre of Lisbon, 5 km from the airport, 300 m from the Praca de Espanha and 450 m from the Zoo in Sete Rios. Ideal for weekend escapes and longer holiday stays, the hotel is entirely airconditioned and features 211 rooms as well as a restaurant, a terrace area, a bar serving snacks 24 hours, private undercover parking and 1 meeting rooms for organising seminars and conferences. Business guests will appreciate use of WiFi Internet access.
